intro: Hieracium oeneolivens, commonly known as the greenish hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a greenish tinge, giving it its common name. Hieracium oeneolivens is often found in temperate climates and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
